images.title: A Feather Bard showing his performing skills
A symbol of the Oath of the Righteous Gander

subclassFeature.name: Path of Fowlish Fury
entries: Barbarians who follow the Path of Fowlish Fury are fearsome fighters that draw their strength from the chaotic energy of the goose, and are known for their wild, erratic combat style and unwavering aggression, often terrifying and disorienting their opponents with vicious strikes, honks and hissing. These barbarians possess a strong sense of loyalty and protectiveness towards their allies, much like the way geese defend their young.

subclassFeature.name: Honking Rage
entries: When you enter a rage you can emit a loud battle honk, audible out to a range of 60 feet, which staggers your opponents and grants you and your allies an edge in combat. Creatures of your choice that can see you and hear the honk must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. Additionally, if you use your Honking Rage during the first round of combat, friendly creatures of your choice that can hear your honk gain a bonus to their attack rolls equal to your rage damage modifier, which lasts until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fowl-Step
entries: Your movements become more erratic and unpredictable, making it harder for enemies to land attacks on you. When you choose to attack recklessly, enemies don't get advantage on the first attack roll made against you each turn.

subclassFeature.name: Honking Retribution
entries: When a creature would hit you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to emit a furious honk, adding your rage damage modifier to your AC against the incoming attack, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Feathered Frenzy
entries: You can enter a feathered frenzy when you rage. If you do so, for the duration of your rage, you sprout a set of flightless goose wings and become covered in a feathery plumage, taking on an intimidating, avian appearance. Your movement speed increases by 20 feet, and you gain a +2 bonus to AC. Additionally, when a creature you can see attacks a friendly creature within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction and buffet your wings in their direction to impose disadvantage on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Flock Defense
entries: You can call upon the power of the flock to protect your allies in battle. When you enter a rage, you can choose a number of friendly creatures you can see within 30 feet of you equal to your Constitution modifier and have them join your flock. For the duration of your rage, members of your flock have resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage, and when a flock member within 10 feet of you misses with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to emit an encouraging honk, allowing that member to make one additional weapon attack against the same target.

subclassFeature.name: College of Feathers
entries: Bards that study within the College of Feathers learn to draw upon the magical properties of goose feathers to channel their magic, imbuing the feathers with fragments of their own magic to bolster themselves and their allies. Feather Bards, as they are commonly known, enjoy the simple life, emulating a lifestyle of comfort, love, mischief, and fierce protection also found in many avian species—particularly the infamous gander.

subclassFeature.name: Avian Infusions
entries: You learn to imbue your goose feathers with raw magical power to create potent arcane explosives and magical effects. As an action, you can expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to charge one mundane feather with arcane power. Once charged, you can't imbue that feather with additional spell slots or a use of your {@classFeature bardic inspiration|Bard|PHB|1|PHB} until the original magic in the feather is expended. The feather retains the spell slots's power for 8 hours, or until it is expended, at which point the feather magically returns to your hand and becomes mundane again. You can expend the feather's power in one of the following ways:

subclassFeature.name: Magical Feathers
entries: You learn to imbue magic into goose feathers. You have a leather pack filled with 5 special mundane feathers in which to imbue power, which can be reused once their imbued power runs out. As a bonus action, you can expend a use of your {@classFeature bardic inspiration|Bard|PHB|1|PHB} and imbue its magic into one of these mundane feathers. When imbued, the feather retains the effects of the {@classFeature bardic inspiration|Bard|PHB|1|PHB} for 8 hours, or until a creature holding the feather expends the magic held within it to gain the effects of that {@classFeature bardic inspiration|Bard|PHB|1|PHB}. The number of special feathers you can carry increases as you gain levels in this class, increasing to 8 at 10th level, and 12 at 14th level. When you reach a level that would increase the number of feathers you can carry, you also gain a number of additional special feathers up to your new carry limit.

entries.name: Losing Your Feathers
entries: If you lose any of your feathers, you can perform a special ritual to gain replacement by spending 1 hour quietly gathering recently dropped feathers of appropriate size from nearby birds and imbuing them to be receptive to your magic.

subclassFeature.name: Bolster
entries: When a creature holding the imbued feather hits a target with a weapon attack within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to expend the feather's magic and magically bolster the attack's damage. The attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} force damage per spell level imbued into the feather.

subclassFeature.name: Detonate
entries: You magically fling the feather towards a point you can see within 30 feet of you, where its magic then detonates in a 5-foot radius sphere. Creatures and objects in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw versus your Bardic spellcasting DC or take {@damage 1d8} force damage per level of the spell imbued into the feather.

subclassFeature.name: Enhance
entries: When a creature holding the imbued feather casts a spell within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to expend the feather's stored magic into the creature's spell, increasing the spell's save DC or attack roll by 1 for every two spell levels imbued into the feather.

subclassFeature.name: Avian Insight
entries: Your attunement to the natural cautious and curious nature of birds gives you insight into the intentions and weaknesses of your enemies. Whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check to determine a creature's intentions, or make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check to seek out hidden objects or traps, you have advantage on the roll if a bird is within 30 feet of your target.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Avian Infusions
entries: You learn the following powers for you Avian Infusion:

subclassFeature.name: Bolster Defense
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a feather carried by you or one creature you can see within 30 feet of you to grant the bearer a +1 bonus to AC until the end of your next turn. The AC bonus increases by 1 for each spell level the feather is imbued with, to a maximum of +6.

subclassFeature.name: Recover
entries: You can use an action to expend the magic of an infused feather carried by you or another creature within 60 feet of you and end one disease or condition affecting the creature carrying that feather. The condition can be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}.

subclassFeature.name: Strengthen Resolve
entries: When you or another creature holding one of your infused feathers makes a saving throw, the holder can spend their reaction and expend the magic in the feather to gain advantage on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Confounding Feathers
entries: You can use your special feathers to create an aura of confusion and misdirection around you. As an action, you can infuse five of your mundane feathers with a concoction of magical effects and toss them into the air to create a swirling aura of color in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on yourself, which lasts for 1 minute. The aura moves with you, and it can't pass through solid objects. While this aura is active, you must {@status concentration||concentrate} on it as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell. If you stop {@status concentration||concentrating}, the aura vanishes immediately. Creatures of your choice that begin their turn in the aura's radius or enter it for the first time on their turn must make a Wisdom saving throw versus your bard spell save DC or suffer the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell. The effects remain for 1 minute, or until the confused creature leaves the aura's radius, or the aura ends. When the aura ends, the feathers return to you and become mundane again. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Domain of the Golden Goose
entries: Clerics that follow the light of the Great Golden Goose seek to shower others in gold, riches and joy, whoever and wherever they may be. They are fierce fighters and close lovers of nature, drawing upon their divine deity for golden blessings they can bestow upon their allies and shining wrath they can rain down on their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks. If you are already proficient, your proficiency bonus is instead doubled for any ability check you make using the aforementioned skill.

subclassFeature.name: Friends of Gold
entries: You learn the {@spell animal friendship} spell. The spell counts as a cleric spell for you, but you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count towards the number of spells you can prepare each day. When you target Geese or other birds with this spell, they have disadvantage on the save.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Feathered Defense
entries: You surround yourself in an armor of golden feathers, which lasts for 1 minute. For the duration, you have a +1 bonus to AC, and whenever you take nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, that damage is reduced by 2. The armor is made up of hundreds of golden feathers. As an action on your turn, you can grab a handful of these feathers and present them to one willing creature within 5 feet of you. When the creature holding the feathers makes a saving throw or ability check, they can call upon the feather's magic to gain advantage on the roll. After the roll is made, the bundle of feathers then vanishes with an ethereal honk.

subclassFeature.name: Wings of Gold
entries: You conjure forth a pair of golden spectral wings that float behind you and last for 1 minute. The wings shed bright light in a 5 foot radius, and dim light for an additional 10 feet. As an action on your turn, you can have the wings flap furiously, creating a sudden rush of wind which extends out from you in a 15-foot cone. Each Huge or smaller creature in the cone's area must succeed on a Strength saving throw versus your cleric spell save DC or be pushed 5 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}. When you reach 17th level in this class, the cone's size increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Treasure
entries: The light of the Golden Goose shines upon you, bringing you good fortune in your search for shiny objects. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception} and {@skill Survival}) checks made to locate objects or traps, and gain a small leather pouch with the symbol of your deity upon it. The leather pouch can hold up to 1/5 cubic foot/6lbs of coins, and honks quietly when shaken.

Whenever you loot a container or corpse for the first time when holding the pouch, you always manage to find at least {@dice 1d4} gp to put inside it. Money held within the pouch can never be stolen, and money can only be taken out of the pouch to use for goose-related business. If you try to take money out with an intention to spend or store it elsewhere, the coins honk at you in defiance of late stage capitalism exploits, explode into tiny golden feathers, and are destroyed. The pouch can hold a total of 50 gp. If you place a nonmagical item in the pouch, it is immediately destroyed and replaced with its monetary value in gold. If there is ever more money in the pouch than it can hold, the entire contents of the pouch is magically donated to the Great Golden Goose,and is lost. If you lose the pouch, it magically returns to your side {@dice 1d4} hours later, though any items or currency within it vanishes as payment for its return.
The bag's storage capacity increases as you gain levels in this class, being able to hold up to 100 gp at 14th level, and 200 gp at 17th.

subclassFeature.name: Goose-Driven Strikes
entries: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with blessed gold from your goosely deity. When you damage a target within a weapon attack or spell, you can expend 5 gp from your Blessed Treasure pouch to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage to that target. The gold in the pouch must be real, and cannot be the product of the {@spell fabricate} spell or other transmutation magic or ability.

The amount of gold you can spend increases as you gain levels in this class. At 14th level, you can spend 10 gp to inflict {@damage 2d6} radiant damage. At 17th level, you can spend 25 gp to inflict {@damage 3d6} radiant damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a Short or Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Chosen of the Golden Goose
entries: When you would normally roll one or more {@dice d6|d6s} to deal additional radiant damage with your Goose-Driven Strikes, you instead always roll the maximum number possible on the dice.

In addition, you can use your action to call forth a divine projection, which appears as a giant goosely head above you. The projection lasts for 1 minute, or until you dismiss it as a bonus action on your turn. For the duration, the projection exudes a golden aura in a 30-foot radius sphere. The area in the aura is illuminated in bright golden light, which dispels magical darkness and illusory effects of 5th-level or lower, and reveals the true form of any shapeshifters that enter its radius. Additionally, friendly creatures of your choice in the aura have advantage on saving throw against spells or other magical effects originating from creatures that have more wealth (in gold and treasure) than they do, such as ancient dragons, royalty, or affluent nobles and wizards. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Squarkmaster
entries: Squarkmasters are specialized fighters that dance around their foes using a set of long scimitar-like weapons, known as goose-blades. These weapons are light and nimble, allowing the bearer to deflect blows and drift across the battlefield with all the grace and precision of a goose in flight.

subclassFeature.name: Goose-Blade Fighting Style
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have a set of two {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades}—special {@itemProperty L|PHB|light} melee weapons that resemble sharpened goose feathers. The goose blades are {@itemProperty L|PHB|light} weapons with the {@itemProperty F|PHB|finesse} property, and deal {@damage 1d8} slashing damage on a hit. You are proficient with these blades, and have a +1 bonus to your AC when you {@action Two-Weapon Fighting|PHB|dual-wield} them. Additionally, you choose one of the Goose-Blade Fighting Styles, detailed below. You can choose another Goose-Blade Fighting Style when you reach 10th level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Channeled Goose-Blades
entries: Your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades} count as magical for the purposes of overcoming immunity and resistances to nonmagical damage.

subclassFeature.name: Winged Maneuvers
entries: At 7th level, you learn the ability to use your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades} to perform acrobatic maneuvers as if they were wings. When you move, you can use your bonus action to flourish your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades} and gain a flight speed equal to your movement speed, which lasts until you stop moving. If you end your turn in the air within this ability, you rapidly descend to the ground, but take no fall damage, provided you are still wielding both {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades}.

subclassFeature.name: Feathery Deflection
entries: You gain the ability to use your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades} to deflect incoming attacks. When you would be hit by a weapon attack that you can see, you can use your reaction to make an attack roll against the incoming blow. If the total of your attack roll matches or exceeds that of the incoming attack, you successfully deflect the blow and take no damage from the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Squarkmaster's Flourish
entries: You learn how to perform a Squarkmaster's Flourish, circumventing a creature's defenses to strike where they are weakest. When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn and hit a creature with one of your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades}, you can use your reaction to flourish the blade, carving into your opponent with goosely ferocity and causing a deep wound that reduces your target's AC by 2 until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Goose-Blade Mastery
entries: You have mastered the art of using {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades} in combat, becoming a whirling dervish of flashing blades and evasive strikes. When you are wielding both {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades} and are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. In addition, when you make an attack roll using your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades}, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Wild Goose
entries: Monks that follow the path of the Wild Goose channel the unrelenting speed and aggression of the majestic goose. Monks who follow this path spend years training in mountain lakes and hidden monasteries, perfecting their movements to match their avian counterparts with unrelenting precision. Wild Goose monks are known for their unyielding spirit, razor-sharp strikes, and overwhelming self belief.

subclassFeature.name: Fowl's Stance
entries: You can use your bonus action and expend 1 ki point to assume a wide stance, your legs mirroring that of a goose's broad wings and your hands narrowing to replicate its fearsome beak. Your stance lasts for 1 minute, or until you end it as a bonus action, are knocked {@condition unconscious} or reduced to 0 hit points. While in this stance, your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and your unarmed strikes deal an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Flowing Fowl
entries: You gain the ability to move across difficult terrain and through obstacles with ease, much like a goose gliding effortlessly across water. You gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed, and nonmagical terrain doesn't slow your movement.

subclassFeature.name: Fowl's Endurance
entries: When you would take damage as a result of failing a saving throw, you can expend a number of ki points up to your Wisdom modifier and reduce the incoming damage by {@dice 1d6} per ki point expended.

subclassFeature.name: Fowl's Great Flight
entries: You gain the ability to soar through the air like a wild goose, moving with incredible speed and agility. As an action, you can spend 5 kit points to gain a flight speed equal to your walking speed, which lasts for 1 minute. For the duration, you ignore magical and nonmagical difficult terrain, and can hover in place if you end your turn in midair, though you still fall to the ground if knocked {@condition prone}. In addition, if you fly at least 10 feet in a straight line before hitting a target with one of your unarmed strikes, you can channel the full force of your flight into your strike, dealing {@damage 1d10} force damage per 10 feet moved, to a maximum of {@damage 5d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Righteous Gander
entries: Paladins who follow the Oath of Righteous Gander uphold the justice of the great geese of power and bring mischief and terror down on their foes. They use their righteous might to protect the lands of geese and seek out to destroy evil beings that would seek to harm them.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the Righteous Gander|Paladin|PHB|Righteous Gander|Honkonomicon|3|Honkonomicon

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain Oath spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as show on the {@table Oath of Righteous Gander spells|Honkonomicon} table.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Righteous Gander
entries: The tenets of the Oath of the Righteous Gander emphasizes the importance of geese and other avian creatures within the world's ecosystem, and celebrates their beauty in all forms. Its four central tenets are as follows:

entries.name: Serve the Goose
entries: Ensure all geese you encounter are well loved and cared for. Through these acts of kindness, show others the importance of caring for the world around them.

entries.name: Spread Joy and Wisdom
entries: Spread playful mischief and laughter wherever you go. In times of great strife, be the one to stand and lead others in song and dance.

entries.name: Migrate Beyond Borders
entries: Life is but a great migration, and you must enjoy the journey it sets you upon. Never settle, for adventure lies just beyond the next border.

entries.name: Peace Was Never an Option
entries: Only through fear can you ensure your enemies remain defeated. Show no mercy to evil, and destroy it utterly, both great and small. Peace cannot be an option for as long as evil clouds the gander's benevolent light.

subclassFeature.name: Gander's Protection
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to protect your allies from harm. Immediately after an attacker within 30 feet of you would hit a creature, you can use your reaction to entomb that creature in a mound of glittering feathers, granting them a +5 bonus to AC and potentially blocking the incoming attack. The bonus to AC remains until the end of your next turn or until the creature moves (thus shaking off the feathers), whichever comes first.

subclassFeature.name: Repel Evil
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to reveal creatures of ill-intention. As an action, you present your {@item holy symbol|PHB} and conjure forth an ethereal golden goose, which appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. The goose is immune to all damage, and immediately gives chase to any evil creatures within 60 feet of you, or any creature that harbors an ill-intent towards you, your allies, or any geese in the vicinity. If there are multiple creatures in range, the goose divides into copies of itself and pursues all creatures equally, though it can do no damage to them. The geese can't pass through terrain or walls, and can't interact with objects. The ethereal goose hisses and honks at the creatures for 1 minute before vanishing in a burst of feathers.

subclassFeature.name: Goose's Great Fury
entries: When a friendly creature of your choice within 10 feet of you makes an {@action opportunity attack||attack of opportunity}, it gains a bonus to the attack roll equal to your Charisma modifier. Additionally, beasts have disadvantage on attack rolls against you and other friendly creatures of your choice for as long as they remain in your aura. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Goose's Great Might
entries: You gain the ability to call forth the spirit of a particularly aggressive goose to aid you in battle. As a bonus action, you can summon a vengeful spirit to appear within 30 feet of you. The spirit takes the form of a spectral goose with a flying speed of 60 feet. When you call forth the spirit, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to {@damage 3d8} + your Charisma modifier. As a bonus action on your turn, you can mentally command the spirit to move up to its speed and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it, or have it take the {@action help} action. Additionally, whenever you {@action cast a spell}, you can choose to cast it through the spirit, provided the spirit is within 30 feet of you, can see your target, and is in range to deliver the spell. The spirit lasts for 1 minute, or until you dismiss it as a bonus action on your turn, fall {@condition unconscious}, or it is subjected to the {@spell dispel magic} spell or similar magic.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Great Honk
entries: At 20th level, you become an embodiment of the great geese of power. As an action, you can transform into an Avatar of the Great Honk, a radiant magical form which lasts for 1 minute. While in this form, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your size increases to Large, and you gain a flying speed of 80 feet.
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.

You can use an action to exude a terrifying hiss that can be heard up to 500 feet away. Creatures of your choice within 120 feet of you that can hear the hiss must make a Wisdom saving throw against your paladin spell save DC or be {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute.

Once per turn, you can use your action to unleash a thunderous cacophony of honks in a 60-foot cone. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw versus your paladin spell save DC, taking {@damage 10d10} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. You can use this ability a number of times during the transformation equal to half your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), rounded down.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Goose Guardian
entries: As a Goose Guardian, you have a deep love and respect for geese, and have formed a special bond with one of these feathered creatures. Your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} follows you everywhere, squawking and honking as it watches over you with a protective eye. Together, you roam the wilds, fighting against any who threaten the sanctity of nature. With your goose by your side, you are a force to be reckoned with, but beware, for their feisty nature can sometimes get them into trouble.

subclassFeature.name: Goose Companion
entries: You gain a {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} that accompanies you on your adventures. Your goose can understand your verbal commands and fights alongside you in combat, taking its turn on your initiative. If you don't issue a command to it, roll on the {@table Goose Behaviour|Honkonomicon} table to determine what action your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} takes that turn. Where possible, the goose always uses its reaction to perform an {@action opportunity attack||attack of opportunity}. You can instruct the goose to restrain itself from making an {@action opportunity attack||attack of opportunity} by spending your reaction and succeeding on a Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check. The DC for this check is equal to the goose's Wisdom score. On a failed save, the goose rolls on the {@table Goose Behaviour|Honkonomicon} table to determine its next action as the sudden act of violence pushes it to momentarily disobey you. The goose uses your proficiency bonus for its attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws in place of its own, and uses your spell save DC instead of its own save DC. Your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} adds your proficiency bonus to its AC and damage rolls, and its hit point maximum is four times your ranger level, or the maximum hit points listed on its stat block (whichever is higher). Your {@creature Goose companion|Honkonomicon} can spend hit dice on a short rest like any other creature, and regains all expended hit dice when it finishes a long rest. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the goose remains by your side and defends you from attackers, but takes no other actions unless an ability specifies it can do so. If your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} dies, its spirit magically forms a new body for itself in 8 hours, provided you don't die during that time. Your reformed companion appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. If you or another creature present was the reason for its death, it immediately moves up to its speed towards them and makes two beak attacks before honking in victory and settling down beside you again. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling} skill.

entries.name: Goose Behaviour Table
entries: Geese are inherently chaotic creatures, and though you and your companion are close-knit, there is sometimes no stopping their fowlish ways from coming out. The {@table Goose Behaviour|Honkonomicon} table determines how chaotic these events are.Your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} can only be under one effect from the table at a time. If you roll again, the new effect replaces the old one.

subclassFeature.name: Fowl Magic
entries: Your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon|goose companion's} attacks are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, and it can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Honks
entries: At 7th level, your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} gains the ability to let out a loud honk that can distract and disorient your enemies. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command your goose to let out a protective honk. Choose one creature within 30 feet of your goose that can hear the honk. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw versus your ranger spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Feathery Fury
entries: Your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon|goose companion's} attacks become even more ferocious. Whenever your goose hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can immediately make one additional attack against the same creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it. If this attack reduces either creature to 0 hit points, the goose briefly gains a spurt of bloodlust; it gains temporary hit points equal to your ranger level, moves up to its speed towards a hostile creature it can see, and rolls on the {@table Goose Behaviour|Honkonomicon} table on its following turn.

subclassFeature.name: Goosely Bond
entries: By 15th level, you and your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} have attained a perfect bond of feathery unison. You both share a telepathic link, allowing you to issue commands to your companion telepathically instead of verbally. In addition, you and your companion always know where each other are, provided you share the same plane of existence. Whenever your goose would take damage, if you are within 60 feet of it, you can choose to take that damage instead. If you do so, the damage can't be reduced in any way. If you take damage, you can have your goose takes some or all of that damage instead, provided it is within 60 feet of you. If you do so, however, the goose falls out with you momentarily—roll on the {@table Goose Behaviour|Honkonomicon} table to determine the next action it takes.

Additionally, when your goose is within 5 feet of you, if you are at 0 hit points or {@condition unconscious}, your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} uses its action to peck you awake or have you regain {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points. Once the goose uses this feature, it can't do so again until it finishes a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rage of a Thousand Honks
entries: Also at 15th level, you can use your action to have your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} enter a bloodthirsty rage, which lasts for 1 minute. For the duration of the rage, your {@creature goose companion|Honkonomicon} has the following features:

items: It ignores any commands you give it, and can only use its movement and action to move towards and attack the closest hostile creature.
When it would roll on the {@table Goose Behaviour|Honkonomicon} table, it always rolls a 6.
It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
Its movement speed is doubled.
Its attacks are made with advantage, and attacks against it are made with disadvantage.
It gains {@sense truesight} out to a range of 30 feet, and creatures have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to {@action hide} or remain hidden from it.
Its attacks roll the normal amount of damage dice.

entries: Once this rage ends, your goose suffers a level of {@condition exhaustion}, and you can't use this feature again until you both finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Avian Menace
entries: Rogues who follow the Avian Menace path are those who have learned to train and control a small troupe of thieving geese to do their bidding. These geese can create chaos on the battlefield, allowing their nefarious master to slip past unnoticed and strike from unexpected angles.

subclassFeature.name: Goose Whisperer
entries: You gain proficiency with Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make to interact with birds when using the aforementioned ability. In addition, you gain a troupe of three small geese, trained to follow your orders without question, and to the best of their ability. The geese troupe shares your AC, Dexterity and Wisdom scores, and proficiency bonus, and have a Strength, Constitution, Intelligence, and Charisma score of {@ability cha 10}. The geese troupe Medium in size, and is considered a single creature for the purposes of combat and movement. The troupe has a movement speed of 30 ft., swim speed of 40 ft., proficiency in all saving throws and Dexterity ({@skill Stealth} and {@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks, and hit points equal to five times your Rogue level (rounding up). The troupe can't attack, but can take other actions as normal, including interacting with intricate objects, such as keys or door handles, and can carry up to 20lbs. The geese troupe can share your space, granting you a +1 bonus to AC if they do so. The goose troupe follow your vocal or physically gestured commands to the best of their ability, provided they can see or hear you, and take their turn in combat directly before or after yours (your choice each turn). If you don't give the troupe a command, they defend themselves and move away from enemies threatening them, but take no other actions. The goose troupe can squeeze through spaces large enough to accommodate a small goose, and have a flight speed of 20 feet, though can't end their movement in the air. If they do so, they float slowly down and settle on the ground. If the goose troupe are reduced to 0 hit points, they scatter in panic and vanish, returning to you after you complete your next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Flock Tactics
entries: You have learned to coordinate your attacks with your troupe of thieving geese. You can use your bonus action to have your geese move up to half their speed and make a single melee weapon attack with their beaks against a target you can see within range. The beaks deal {@damage 3d4} piercing damage, have a range of 5 feet, are considered a {@itemProperty F|PHB|Finesse} weapon, and can trigger your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1|PHB} feature as if you had made the attack roll on your own turn that round. The geese troupe is proficient in this attack, and their attack bonus is equal to your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Winged Ambush
entries: You have trained your geese to set up ambushes for you. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command your geese troupe to fly to a point you can see within range and attempt to {@action hide} there, making their Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check with advantage.

When you target a creature with a weapon attack, and that creature is within 20 feet of the geese troupe and hasn't detected them, you can use your reaction to have the geese launch a surprise attack against the target, granting you advantage on the attack roll, and reducing the target's AC by {@dice 1d4} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Pocket Pilfering
entries: If you hit with the aforementioned weapon attack, you can have your goose troupe attempt to pilfer the pockets of your target during the confusion. Your goose troupe must make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check versus the target's AC. On a success, the troupe steals a carried item from the target (provided they can carry it), and can immediately move up to their speed in a direction of your choice without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all expended uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Menace
entries: You have trained your geese to sow chaos and distribution wherever they go. As an action, you can command your troupe of thieving geese to rush forwards up to their speed in a straight line, attacking any creature in their path. Each creature caught in the goose's path must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier), taking {@damage 6d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, if a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, the goose troupe steals one small object the creature is carrying, provided it is light enough for them to do so. The geese troupe then disperses and returns to your side with any stolen items in tow. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Goose-Blooded
entries: Goose-Blooded sorcerers have ancestral ties to the great ancient goose spirits of old. Infused with goosely magic, these mysterious individuals are often born with many bird-like features, from wide eyes and feathered heads to webbed feet or lightened bones. Regardless what sort of mutations manifest, every goose-blooded has a deep hatred for most other beings, and a penchant for mischief. However, they are fiercely protective of their close friends, whom they see as their flock.

subclassFeature.name: Goose-Blooded Magic
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the {@table Goose-Blooded Spells|Honkonomicon} table. Each spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be {@filter an enchantment or transmutation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer;wizard;warlock|school=e;t}, or any goose spell listed in the {@item Honkonomicon|Honkonomicon} or {@loader Circle of the Honk|collection/Vall Syrene; Circle of the Honk.json} supplements.

subclassFeature.name: Goose-Blooded Quirks
entries: When you choose this class at 1st level, you exhibit a quirk due to your fowlish heritage. Roll on or choose from the table below to determine what notable quirk your origin has bestowed upon you.

subclassFeature.name: Honking Rebuke
entries: You can spend your reaction to unleash a magical honk of defiance when you or a friendly creature you can see within 10 feet of you would be targeted by an attack roll or spell. If that spell's effects would call for a saving throw, you grant the target advantage on the save. Alternatively, you cause the attack roll to be made with disadvantage.
At 18th level, the range of this ability increases to 30 feet.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Honks
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Honking Rebuke|Sorcerer|PHB|Goose-Blooded|Honkonomicon|1|Honkonomicon}, you can spend 2 sorcery points to empower it and damage your enemies. You unleashed an amplified, bellowing honk in a 15-foot cone. In addition to the effects of your {@subclassFeature Honking Rebuke|Sorcerer|PHB|Goose-Blooded|Honkonomicon|1|Honkonomicon}, creatures in the cone's area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, when a creature fails its saving throw, you can spend 2 sorcery points to {@condition stunned||stun} that creature until the end of your next turn. You can {@condition stunned||stun} a number of creatures with this ability equal to your Charisma modifier, expended sorcery points for each creature individually.
At 18th level, the range of your Empowered Honk's cone increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Gander's Flight
entries: You can use your bonus action to magically transform your arms into a pair of goose wings, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed. The wings last until you are {@condition incapacitated}, you die, or you dismiss them as a bonus action. You can't wield weapons or interact with objects while using these wings, but the wings do count as an {@item arcane focus|PHB} for you, and you can still {@action cast a spell||cast spells} by beating your wings furiously to perform any somatic components the spells require.

subclassFeature.name: Goose-Blooded God
entries: You have fully embraced your goosely nature and can use your action to transform yourself into a powerful goose-like monstrosity with a long neck, lashing bladed tongue and razor-sharp talons. While in your monstrous form, you gain the following features:

items: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
You have a bonus to your AC equal to your Charisma modifier.

You ignore the somatic requirement of spells, and when you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher, you can perform a honk using your {@subclassFeature Empowered Honks|Sorcerer|PHB|Goose-Blooded|Honkonomicon|6|Honkonomicon} feature in place of the spell's verbal component. If you do so, resolve the {@subclassFeature Empowered Honks|Sorcerer|PHB|Goose-Blooded|Honkonomicon|6|Honkonomicon|Empowered Honk's} effects first. If an effect would prevent your spell from being cast, such as {@spell counterspell}, your empowered honk also fails, though its use is still expended.

You can use your action to make two melee weapon attacks: one with your bladed tongue and one with your talons. You are proficient with these attacks, and they use your Charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls, instead of Strength or Dexterity. Your tongue has a reach of 10 feet and deals {@damage 3d8} slashing damage on a hit. Your talons have a reach of 5 feet and deal {@damage 4d6} slashing damage on a hit.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 7 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: The Honking Chaos
entries: You have become a follower of {@creature Anserath, the Honking Chaos|Honkonomicon|Anserath}, the multi-headed demonic goose-lord of the Abyss. Anserath's motivations are incomprehensible and fleeting, its multiple heads each drawn to their own machinations of mischief and neither ever working truly in tandem with the other. Anserath's power comes from the raw chaotic magic it wields, which often drives it to unpredictable, senseless acts of rage and violence. You might have chosen to become a follower of Anserath willingly, through devout rituals to the goose-lord as a cleric would a deity, or perhaps you simply found one of Anserath's many cursed items and drew power from it for your own means, without its knowledge. Regardless of your relationship with your patron, you feel Anserath's destructive desires flow through you, channeling its power to fuel your own ends.

subclassFeature.name: Anserath's Unpredictable Blessing
entries: Your connection to the dread Anserath allows you to channel chaos magic against your foes. You have a pool of chaos dice that you spend to fuel these abilities, which are {@dice d6s}. The number of dice in the pool equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) + half your warlock level, rounded down. When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you would make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to spend chaos dice from your pool, rolling a {@dice d6} and reducing the total of the attack roll, saving throw or ability check by the total. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of one die). If you spend more than one chaos die, roll them all at once and add them together to determine the total.

entries.name: Anserath Takes Notice
entries: If you roll a double 1 or double 6 when rolling chaos dice, Anserath takes a brief interest in your affairs, and its chaotic magic surges through you; you take force damage equal to the total rolled on your chaos dice. In addition, at the end of your next long rest, Anserath makes a demand of you. Roll on the {@table Chaotic Requests|Honkonomicon} table to determine what the request is, and the consequences or boons for failing or completing the task. You must complete the task within {@dice 1d4} hours of receiving the request, or it fails.
The number of chaos dice in your pool resets after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Honking Chaos lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you:

subclassFeature.name: Murderous Chaos
entries: When you reduce a creature with a hit point maximum of 40 or greater to 0 hit points, you regain 1 expended chaos die. If you have all your chaos dice when you trigger this feature, you instead gain temporary hit points equal to your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Chaos
entries: The chaotic magic in your veins grants you greater control over your environment. Whenever you roll a dice for any reason, you can spend two chaos dice to reroll it, though you must abide by the new result. If the new number is the same as your previous roll, you receive a chaotic backlash of energy as the world stabilizes itself from your meddling; roll a number of chaos dice equal to your Charisma modifier. For each die result of a 1, that chaos die can't be used until the next dawn. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Anserath's Siphon
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction and expend 2 or more chaos dice to attempt to siphon away some of its magic. Roll the chaos dice and add their numbers together. If the total is greater than the casting creature's spellcasting DC, you create one of the following effects:

items.name: Interrupted Siphon
entries: The spell fails, and you regain 1 expended warlock spell slot.

items.name: Bolstered Siphon
entries: The spell is cast, and you regain {@dice 1d6} hit points for each chaos dice expended. If you are already at your hit point maximum, you gain temporary hit points instead.

subclassFeature.name: Fowlemancy
entries: As a Fowlemancer, you have mastered the art of casting spells with the aid of a flock of tiny geese that you keep in a special {@item component pouch|PHB}. These feathered creatures act as your conduit for magic, allowing you to harness their energy and unleash powerful spells upon your foes. However, you must take care to treat these geese with the utmost respect, for they are not mere tools, but living creatures with their own needs and desires.

subclassFeature.name: Bag o' Geese
entries: You gain a magical component pouch leading to a small extradimensional space. The space contains a small coop and a flock of tiny, angry geese. There are a number of geese in your flock equal to your wizard level. If you lose the pouch, you can make a new one as you would your spellbook, thoughyou can't make copies of your bag for safe-keeping. If you create a new bag, it destroys the old one. Every bag leads to the same extradimensional space, ensuring the geese are never lost if you lose your bag.

The geese must be fed and watered each day, or they vanish and don't reappear until the start of the following dawn. As an action, you can release all the tiny geese, who follow you around as a duckling would their mother. You can recall all your tiny geese into their bag as a bonus action.

You can expend the geese to enhance your magic or perform magical abilities. Any geese that you expend in this way vanish in a puff of feathers after they are used, and reappear in your bag at the next dawn.

entries.name: Goosely Enhancements
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that would require a material cost of 300 gp or less, you can use one of the geese from your bag to replace the cost. When used in this way, the goose then vanishes with an audible honk.

entries.name: Hurl Geese
entries: As an action, you can reach into your bag and pull out handfuls of tiny geese to hurl at creatures you can see within 60 feet of you. You can pull out a total number of geese this way equal to your wizard level divided by 3 rounded down. As part of the action, make a ranged spell attack for each goose you pulled out. On a hit, the goose crashes into your target and pecks at it furiously before exploding in a burst of feathers, dealing {@damage 1d4} piercing damage and {@damage 1d4} force damage. On a miss, the goose returns to your bag at the end of your turn with a defeated honk.

entries.name: Fowlish Empowerment
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that requires an attack roll or calls for a saving throw, you can pull a goose from your bag to act as a conduit for that spell, enhancing its properties. The spell's magic surrounds the goose, who then takes flight and delivers the spell to its intended target (roll to attack or have the target make a saving throw as normal). The goose is then consumed as the spell reaches its target, and marks the target with the chaotic energy of the goose gods. This energy lasts for 10 minutes, or until the creature dies, or the energy is expended. If the spell fails to cast (due to the effects of the {@spell counterspell} spell, for example), the goose is not expended, and returns to your bag at the end of your turn.

entries.name: Expending Chaos Energy
entries: When a target marked with chaos energy makes a saving throw, ability check, or attack roll, you can draw that energy back to you, reducing the total of the target's roll by {@dice 1d4}. You can draw the energy back to you before or after the target makes the roll, but before you know the outcome.

You can use more geese as a conduit when you cast a spell as you gain levels in this class, increasing to 2 geese at 6th level, 3 geese at 13th, and 4 geese at 17th. Each goose used in this way increases the chaos energy you draw back to youby an additional {@dice d4}, to a maximum of {@dice 4d4}.

subclassFeature.name: Goose Quill
entries: When you select this school, you gain a magical quill crafted from a goose's feather. When you use the quill to copy a spell into your spellbook, the gold and time you must spend to do so is halved. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Goose's Mark
entries: When a creature fails a saving throw against one of your spells, or you hit it with a spell attack, you can bind one of your tiny geese to the spell's target. An ethereal form of the tiny goose appears atop the creature, honking loudly and beating its wings in a distracting manner for 1 minute, or until you end it as a bonus action. The goose follows its target relentlessly and always knows where it is, unless that creature moves to another plane of existence, at which point the goose randomly picks a new target (friend or foe!) within 30 feet of it. For the duration, any attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker can see the goose atop it, and the affected creature can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

This feature doesn't have any effect on spells that don't specify a target, such as {@spell fireball} or {@spell hallucinatory terrain}. If you cast a spell that specifies multiple targets, you can target every creature with this feature, but must expend a different goose for each.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Flock's Fury
entries: You can call upon the aid of all your tiny geese in battle. As an action on your turn, if you have at least ten geese available to you, you can empty out the contents of your Bag O' Geese to conjure forth a flock of fury comprised of all the geese at your disposal. The flock surrounds you in a 10-foot radius sphere that moves with you and lasts for ten minutes, or until you use a bonus action to call them back into your bag. The flock can't be targeted or damaged, but is considered magical for the purposes of an {@spell antimagic field} or similar effects. For the duration, you and creatures of your choice in the flock's area are considered to be in half cover, and the flock's innate magic grants you a +1 bonus to your spell save DC and spell attack rolls. Additionally, hostile creatures that begin their turn in the flock's area or move into the area for the first time on a turn are harassed by the angry geese, and take {@damage 1d6} piercing damage for every goose in the flock, to a maximum of {@damage 6d6}.

You can call upon these geese to fuel your other Fowlemancy features as normal. If you start your turn with less than 5 geese remaining, the flock disperses back into your bag and your Flock's Fury ends.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Goose Mother
entries: Also at 14th level, you add more tiny geese to your flock, increasing its size. You gain an additional number of tiny geese equal to your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: The Great Migration
entries: You can call upon your flock of geese to carry you and your allies. As an action, if you have at least 10 geese available, you can summon forth the contents of your Bag O' Geese to form a large flock capable of carrying up to eight Medium or Small creatures, or three Large creatures. The flock has a flight speed of 80 feet, and can fly for up to 4 hours before retreating back into your bag to rest. While in flight, the flock provides half cover to the creatures being carried, and always knows which way is north. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Goose MotherAlso at 14th level, you add more tiny geese to your flock,increasing its size. You gain an additional number of tinygeese equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Anserath's Fire
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a spell attack, you can cause that attack to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Bird's Eye Precision
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make using {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades}. When you hit a target with both your goose blades in the same turn, you can also make one additional weapon attack against that target.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Honk
entries: When you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast}, you can cause that strike to emit a thunderous honk. The target is then {@condition deafened} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Feathered Teleportation
entries: When you would be hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to explode in a burst of feathers and teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 90 feet of you. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fowl's Water Dance
entries: While you are wielding both your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades}, creatures have disadvantage on {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} made against you.

optionalfeature.name: Gander's Flight
entries: You can cast the {@spell fly} spell on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Gander's Fury
entries: When you hit a creature with a spell attack, you can make one melee or ranged weapon attack as a bonus action. This weapon attack is magical, and uses your Charisma modifier for the attack and damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Ganderstrike
entries: Once on your turn when you make an attack roll with your {@item goose-blade|Honkonomicon|goose-blades}, you can choose to take a cumulative −1 penalty to the attack roll to increase the attack's damage by {@damage 1d4} per penalty taken. You can take a number of penalties equal to your proficiency bonus. For example, if you chose to take 2 penalties, you would make the attack roll with a −2 modifier, but deal an additional {@damage 2d4} damage to yourtarget, should the attack hit.

optionalfeature.name: Goose's Gaze
entries: You can use your action to see through the eyes of any goose within 120 feet of you for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Strike of Chaos
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can force that creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 10d6} force damage and is transported to a random location in the Plane of Pandemonium or an equivalent plane of madness for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effects. You must then finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

reward.name: Blessing of Plumage
entries: {@i Level 1–4}
A creature you touch grows golden feathers as if you cast the {@spell plumage armor|Honkonomicon}* spell. Once you do so, you can't do it again until the next dawn.

reward.name: Blessing of the Avian Sight
entries: {@i Level 11–16}
As an action, you channel the enigmatic gaze of the Goose as if you casted the {@spell gaze of the golden goose|Honkonomicon}* spell. Once you do so, you can't do it again until the next dawn.

reward.name: Blessing of the Golden Quill
entries: {@i Level 17–20}
You own a feather of the Great Golden Goose herself, that you can use as if it was the {@spell power word quill|Honkonomicon}* spell. Once you do so, the feather loses all power.

reward.name: Blessing of the Guardian Goose
entries: {@i Level 5–10}

A celestial gander is assigned to look over you, and you can summon it as an action as if it was the {@spell summon goose guardian|Honkonomicon}* spell (Honking Defender only). Once you do so, you can't do it again until the next dawn.

reward.name: Charm of the Honkeous Laughter
entries: {@i Level 1–4}
This charm allows you to cast the {@spell honkeous laughter|Honkonomicon}* spell as an action, no components required. Once used three times, the charm goes away.

reward.name: Charm of the Honktropy
entries: {@i Level 11–16}
This charm allows you to cast the {@spell prismatic spray}* spell as an action, no components required. Once used three times, the charm goes away.

reward.name: Charm of the Primordial Havonk
entries: {@i Level 17–20}

You own a goose figurine made of the same materials that the Ur-goose is made of, that you can break to activate the {@spell call of the Ur-goose|Honkonomicon}* spell. Once you do so, the figurine loses its power.

reward.name: Charm of the Wild Goose Chase
entries: {@i Level 5–10}

One pair of boots or shoes in your possession becomes a pair of {@item wild goose chasers|Honkonomicon}* (DM's choice) for the next 10 days. The charm then vanishes from you and the items go back to normal.

reward.name: Curse of the Golden Feathers
entries: This is similar to the curse that falls on anybody that touches a {@creature goose of the golden feathers|Honkonomicon}, punishing the greed of whoever wants to pick the goose's golden feathers.

entries.name: Pronouncement
entries: When Mother Goose recounts the fable of the goose of the golden feathers, she says "Who wishes to pluck a feather of the golden goose, will find the feather to be as sticky as its desires."

entries.name: Burden
entries: The target that touched the protected item or creature becomes {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained}, the target is stuck to the item or creature and will follow it wherever it goes, unless one of them is teleported away. Another creature touching or hitting with a melee attack the cursed target is also targeted by this curse, becoming stuck to the touched creature instead.

entries.name: Resolution
entries: The curse lasts until the cursed target makes a gesture of genuine generosity, like giving away its precious belongings at least as worth as the average value of a magic item for the character's level or the creature's CR (see {@book Magic Items in the Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG|7|Magic Items}). Separating with teleportation the target and the touched object or creature also breaks the curse.

reward.name: Feathered Doom
entries: One of Anserath's favorite tricks, it turns the creature into an archenemy of all goosekind.

entries.name: Pronouncement
entries: The creature hears a threatening, otherworldly honk that is full of hate.

entries.name: Burden
entries: Every goose creature with Intelligence 3 or lower is hostile to the cursed creature and attacks it on sight. Other goose creatures make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving, becoming hostile to the cursed creature on a failed save.

entries.name: Resolution
entries: The target must become part of a flock of goose creatures for a full, uninterrupted week. If the target approaches the flock with this intention in mind, then a {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check is enough to prevent the geese from attacking it (unless the geese have other reasons to attack). During the week, the target must spend at least 8 hours per day in the company of its flock, behaving just like them. After doing so, the curse is lifted.

reward.name: Killing the Golden Goose
entries: Killing a creature protected by this curse is a sure way to lose one's wealth.

entries.name: Pronouncement
entries: The fabled goose of the golden eggs provides one golden egg per day. Who kills it, usually in hope to harvest more golden eggs from the goose's dead body, brings down this curse on itself. From this comes the idiom "killing the goose of the golden eggs", known to many.

entries.name: Burden
entries: The target has disadvantage on any ability check to find precious goods or accumulate wealth of any kind. Whenever one or more dice are rolled to randomly determine the amount or the value of treasures or items found by the character, the result is always the one less convenient for the target (like the lowest amount of coins, or the highest price for a magic item).

entries.name: Resolution
entries: The protected creature that was killed must be brought back to life, or the target must find an egg from a golden goose, hatch it, protect it and nurture it personally until it becomes adult. This usually takes six months.

reward.name: Uncanny Goose
entries: The creature crossed the geese of power and now is being stalked by a magical, unkillable goose.

entries.name: Pronouncement
entries: This curse is usually signaled by a goose-shaped birthmark on the body of the target. Depending on the effect intended by the cursing power, killing such a creature can transmit the curse to the killer

entries.name: Burden
entries: Whenever the target rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, a {@creature domestic goose|Honkonomicon} uncannily appears in a free space within 20 feet of the target. The goose is immune to all divination and mind-reading magical effects, and any kind of magic effectively registers that the goose is not there (but it is). The goose can be killed or imprisoned, but comes back to life at full hit points or frees itself as soon as nobody is watching it.

entries.name: Resolution
entries: The target must be transformed into a beast that is a goose creature, then receive the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

reward.name: Webbed feet
entries: A territory that is sacred to geese will curse the feet of who walks through it.

entries.name: Pronouncement
entries: By the entrance of the area, a writing in {@language Abyssal}, {@language Celestial} or {@language Primordial} says: "Who dares to step in the land of geese, will only take goose steps."

entries.name: Burden
entries: The targets receives the legs effect of the {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon}* spell.

entries.name: Resolution
entries: The target has to befriend a goose creature.

reward.name: Woeful Honking
entries: The character seriously disrespected a goose creature or goosekind in general, and will now suffer the consequences by sounding just like the thing that the character offended.

entries.name: Pronouncement
entries: The curse can be pronounced by a powerful goose creature or spellcaster, or just be part of the folklore and rituals revolving around geese. The curse usually recites: "Whoever will speak ill of the goose, will then speak just as the goose".

entries.name: Burden
entries: When the target first receives the curse, and when the target rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, it can express itself only through honking for 10 minutes (therefore can't cast spells with verbal components or use magic items that require an activation word). Roll a {@dice d20} every 10 minutes: on a result from 11 to 20, the target's speech ability goes back to normal.

entries.name: Resolution
entries: The target must create, commission or find a work of art that shows the beauty, power or good qualities of geese, and donate it to a place dedicated to them (like a temple of the Great Golden Goose.)

reward.name: Wrath of the Goose
entries: The mind of the character is shattered by fowlish thoughts, becoming confused and dangerous. This curse usually originates from Anserath, the Honking Chaos.

entries.name: Pronouncement
entries: By the protected area, object or creature, it is possible to hear several chaotic honks that come from nowhere but can be heard directly in the mind.

entries.name: Burden
entries: When the target rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, it receives the effects of the {@spell honkeous laughter|Honkonomicon}* spell. If this happens again while the target is under the effect of this spell, the target uses its reaction to move towards the closest non-goose creature and make a melee attack against it.

entries.name: Resolution
entries: The target must find the transcendent peace of the Great Golden Goose. This can be achieved by going through a migration of enlightenment (a quest at the DM's choice), touching the {@item Golden Egg of Divinity|Honkonomicon}, or receiving a {@spell remove curse} spell from a goose creature that considers the target worthy of it.

images.title: The fabled curse of the golden feathers at work

spell.name: Call of the Ur-Goose

m.text: 5000 gp worth of ambers which the spell consumes and the figurine of a goose carved in wood of a tree at least 500 years old worth at least 100 gp

entries: You summon the terrifying presence of the {@creature Ur-Goose|Honkonomicon}, which appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet and stays until the spell ends.
You have no control on the {@creature Ur-Goose|Honkonomicon}, and it's hostile to all creatures.

Being weakened by the ordeal, the {@creature Ur-Goose|Honkonomicon} has no legendary actions available during the first {@dice 1d4} rounds, but can use an action to perform one of its legendary actions. After those rounds have passed, the {@creature Ur-Goose|Honkonomicon} gains 3 legendary actions and can use an action to end the spell and return to its native plane

After {@dice 1d4} rounds, the {@creature Ur-Goose|Honkonomicon} can use an action to end the spell and return to where it came from, or you can end the spell as an action while {@status concentration||concentrating} and banish the {@creature Ur-Goose|Honkonomicon} into where it was before being summoned. Otherwise,this spell will last after its duration, won't be dispelled by any means and won't end, and the {@creature Ur-Goose|Honkonomicon} won't unwillingly leave by any means but a {@spell wish} spell unless the wooden goose figurine is destroyed.

spell.name: Chaos Honk
entries: You project with your voice the powerful honk of Anserath, the Honking Chaos, in a 60-foot cone in front of you. Each object in the area takes {@damage 6d8} thunder damage. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or take the same damage and roll {@dice 1d10} to determine an additional random effect:

items: 1–2: falls {@condition prone}, drops anything it's holding and is {@condition unconscious} until the end of its next turn. Creatures that can't be put to sleep by magic are immune to this effect.
3–6: falls {@condition prone} and can express only honking (therefore i.e. can't talk and can't use its voice to provide verbal components or spell activation words) until the end of its next turn.
7: grows a blue beard and mustaches made of plumes that disappear in 1 week.
8: grows a purple tail made of plumes that disappears in 1 week.
9: grows a red crest made of plumes that disappears in 1 week.
10: no additional effect.

entries: For each die scoring a 1 in this spell's damage roll, targets roll an additional time on this table, but can't be subject to the same effect twice.
A creature that succeeds in the saving throw takes only half as much damage and no other effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} thunder damage and targets take an additional random effect for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Conjure Honkland Beings
entries: You summon goose creatures that appear in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

items: One goose creature of CR 2 or lower
Two goose creatures of CR 1 or lower
Four goose creatures of CR 1/2 or lower
Eight goose creatures of CR 1/4 or lower

entries: A summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

spell.name: Find Giant Goose Steed
entries: You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong and loyal steed, creating a long-lasting bond with the creature. The steed has the statistic of a {@creature giant goose|Honkonomicon}, though it is a {@creature Giant Goose Steed (Great Golden Goose)|Honkonomicon|celestial (bound to the Great Golden Goose)}, {@creature Giant Goose Steed (Anserath)|Honkonomicon|fiend (bound to Anserath, the Goose of Chaos)} or an {@creature Giant Goose Steed (Ur-goose)|Honkonomicon|elemental (bound to the Ur-Goose)} at your choice instead of a beast. Additionally, the steed has an intelligence of 6 and gains the ability to understand one of your languages.

Your steed serves you as a mount, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit. If you wish so, any spell you cast that targets only you while mounted on your steed also targets the summoned creature.

Furthermore, while mounted on your steed whenever you roll a 1 or a 20 on the {@dice d20} your goose steed enters a status of confused frenzy until the end of your next turn. While frenzied, the goose steed can't be controlled as a mount but instead takes its turn on its own initiative. During its turn, roll {@dice 1d10}:

items: 1: The goose mount uses its action to make an attempt to force you to dismount. You must make a contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) ability check against it or fall {@condition prone} in an adjacent space.
2–6: The goose mount doesn't move or take actions this turn.
7–8: The goose mount moves toward the nearest creature (but you) and uses its action to make a melee attack against it.
9–10: The goose mount acts normally but on its own.

entries: When the steed drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your steed at any time as an action, causing it to disappear. In either case, casting this spell again summons the same steed, restored to its hit point maximum. While your steed is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with each other telepathically. You can't have more than one steed bonded by this spell at a time. As an action, you can release the steed from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear

spell.name: Gander's Blow
entries: A thick and hard gander beak grows instead of your mouth (if any). When you take the {@action Attack} action while this spell is active, you can make an extra unarmed strike with the beak as a part of that action. This attack can be used for a {@action grapple} attempt and the beak counts as a free hand for that purpose.
While this spell is active, you can communicate only by honking (therefore you can't talk and can't use your voice to provide verbal components or spell activation words).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra attack deals {@damage 1d6} additional bludgeoning damage on a hit for each spell slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, your neck grows longer and your gander beak attack has a range of 5 feet more for each spell slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Gaze of the Golden Goose
entries: For the spell's duration, your eyes become a golden honky void imbued with goose power. One creature of your choice that you can see within range gains one of the following effects. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to target another creature with this spell. The same creature can't benefit from more than one effect at time.

entries.name: Happy Honkness
entries: The target gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns until the spell ends.

entries.name: Feather Fury
entries: The target gains advantage to attack rolls until the spell ends.

entries.name: Goosey Glibness
entries: The target doubles its speed and doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||attacks of opportunity} until the spell ends.

spell.name: Gooseance

time.condition: which you take when you or any other creature within range fails an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You sternly honk at failure. A willing creature you can see targeted by this spell adds {@dice 1d4} to the failing roll that triggered the reaction, potentially turning it into a success.

Whether this happens or not, for the next minute you and that creature can't express anything except by honking (therefore i.e. can't talk and can't use its voice to provide verbal components or spell activation words).

spell.name: Goosefeather Fall

time.condition: which you take when you fall

entries: As you fall, you wave the feather in the direction of a creature within range, which is forced to make a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet toward you and fall with you (this can cause you or the target to end your turn in the same space).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Honkeous Laughter
entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} by geese. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the target finds every non-goose creature ridiculous and funny and upon seeing any of them is compelled to burst in a loud honk at the start of each of its turn, being audible within 300 feet and dealing {@damage 1d6} thunder damage to any non-goose creature within 5 feet from it.
At the end of each of its turns, if the target can't see any creature, it can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Plumage Armor
entries: A thick, soft and shiny goose plumage grows on the target, covering most of its skin. The target gains 5 temporary hit points; while having these hit points it has resistance to fire and cold damage and ignores any negative effect for fighting underwater.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Power Word Quill
entries: You utter the secret name of the Sacred Quill of Power, which pops in your hand. Any creature can use it in any of the following ways, then the spell ends.

entries.name: Tickle to Death
entries: You tickle a creature within 5 feet of you with the Sacred Quill of Power. To do so you must use your action to make a melee spell attack against the creature.
