On a hit the target falls {@condition prone} and is {@condition incapacitated} laughing while you {@status concentration||concentrate} on this spell and stay within 5 feet of the target. At the end of your next turn, if the effect is still on, the target dies and the spell ends. If the target has legendary action, it takes {@damage 10d10} psychic damage instead of dying.

entries.name: Write the Honkswer
entries: You pose a question to the Sacred Quill of Power, which instantly writes the true answer to that question (if any) on the nearest flat surface, then the spell ends. The Quill will answer in any possible moment to the first question made by the creature holding it, no matter if meant to be "the" question. The answer will be true, but not necessarily complete or useful.

This unique magical and legendary plume is exactly the same as a normal quill, except for the powers above. It can be normally destroyed or seized by force from its possessor with a successful contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

When the spell ends, the Sacred Quill of Power turns into a normal quill. Each time you cast this spell again before a year has passed since last time there is a cumulative {@chance 10} chance to summon a normal quill instead of the Sacred Quill of Power.

entries.name: Variant: Power Word Quill and Legendary Creatures
entries: The power word quill spell can't instantly kill creatures with legendary actions but deals them a great amount of damage instead. This is similar to how a {@item vorpal sword||vorpal weapon} works against a legendary creature.

If you are playing a campaign with a more gritty or realistic style where each and every creature can die a sudden death, you can decide to ignore this rule and let power word quill instantly kill even a legendary creature. As a DM, be aware that this change could enable the characters to kill without a saving throw even extremely powerful creatures, like the {@creature tarrasque} or an ancient dragon.

spell.name: Quill the Dead
entries: A tiny illusory quill moved by a skeletal hand appears near a creature you can see within range, and mimicking your moves gently tickles the target forcing it to make an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. A creature failing this save has disadvantage to ability checks and, if able, laughs so loudly that any creature within 100 feet can hear the laughter clearly. A creature without feet or armpits is immune to the effects of this spell.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Storm of the Honking Chaos
entries: You call forth the power of Honking Chaos which comes in the form of six 10-foot radius spherical bursts of honking nonsense within range. A creature in the area of more than one burst is affected only once. As a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns, until the spell ends, you can move any number of the bursts by up to 20 feet within the spell's range.
At the end of each of your turns, you choose on of the following effects:

entries.name: Cachonkphony
entries: Loud and senseless honking fills the air in the area and can be heard up to a mile away. Creatures in the area are {@condition deafened} until the end of your next turn and must make a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} thunder damage. Creatures made of inorganic materials such as stone or crystal have disadvantage to this saving throw. Nonmagical objects in the area that are not worn or carried also take the damage.

entries.name: Flaming Plumes
entries: A fluffy cloud of burning plumes fills the area and creatures in it must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d12} fire damage. Flammable objects that are not worn or carried instantly ignite and the area fills with heavily obscuring smoke that dissipates at the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Geeseturbing Madness
entries: Anserath's madness permeates minds within the area. Any creature in the area has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made to keep their {@status concentration}, and must make a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage and be able to express only honking until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Thonkxic Eggs
entries: Multiple rotten eggs materialize midair and suddenly explode, filling the air with a sulfur-smelling gas. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d12} poison damage, drop {@condition prone} reeking and be {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Summon Goose Guardian

m.text: A platinum goose figurine worth at least 500 gp

entries: You call forth a {@creature goose spirit|Honkonomicon}. It manifests in a different corporeal form depending on the Goose of Power it is bound with, and appears in an unoccupied space within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Goose Spirit|Honkonomicon} Stat block. When you cast the spell choose between Honking Defender, Chaos Gander or Primal Honker. Your choice determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, use the higher level whenever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Swift Quillver

components.m: an empty quiver and a goose feather

entries: You transmute your quiver so it produces an endless supply of goose quill shaped darts, which seems to leap into your hand when you reach for it. These magical quills can be thrown or used as ammunition for any bow, crossbow or {@item blowgun|PHB}, having a range of 100/400 ft and dealing {@damage 1d12} piercing damage regardless of the weapon used.
Upon hitting a foe with any of these quills, once per turn you can channel the magic of a Great Goose of Power on the quill triggering one of these effects:

entries.name: Chaos Quill
entries: The quill deals an additional {@damage 1d8} force damage and a target hit by this quill must use its reaction to move in a random direction up to its speed (this movement can provoke {@action opportunity attack||attacks of opportunity}) as a chaos pulse flows in its body.

entries.name: Golden Quill
entries: The quill deals an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage and a target hit by this quill is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn as a light flash erupts by the quill.

entries.name: Ur-quill
entries: The quill deals an additional {@damage 1d8} poison damage and a target hit by this quill is {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn as the quill transmutes in thorns and vines entangling it.

spell.name: Web Limbs
entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within range is forced to make a Constitution saving throw that can willingly fail. A creature failing this saving throw is subject to one of these effects (your choice):

entries.name: Webbed Feet
entries: Target's feet become webbed. The creature gains swimming speed equal to its normal speed (adding it to any swimming speed it already has got) when not wearing footwear, but upon taking the {@action Dash} action it must make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) {@dc 10} ability check or fall {@condition prone}. A creature without feet or with already webbed feet is immune to this effect.

entries.name: Webbed Hands
entries: Target's hands become webbed. The creature gains swimming speed equal to its normal speed (adding it to any swimming speed it already has got) but can't wear gloves or rings and has disadvantage to any Dexterity ability check that involves a fine use of fingers, such as pickpocket attempts or using {@item thieves' tools|PHB}. A creature with no hands or with already webbed hands is immune to this effect.
A {@spell remove curse}, {@spell greater restoration} or {@spell heal} spell will revert any of these effects.

images.title: Sir Goose on his faithful giant goose steed

baseitem.name: Goose-Blade
entries: Blades used in pairs by {@class Fighter|PHB|Squarkmasters|Squarkmaster|Honkonomicon}.

item.name: Apparagoose of Honkish
entries: This item first appears to be a Medium metallic egg weighing 100 pounds. The egg has a hidden engraved phrase, which can be found with a successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. Uttering the sentence hatches the egg into a large metallic goose, with a porthole on his rear, allowing two Medium or smaller creatures to crawl inside. Ten feathers-like levers are set in a row at the far end, each in a neutral position, able to move either up or down.
The apparagoose is a Large object with the following statistics:

items.name: Speed:
items.entry: 20 ft., fly 40 ft. (or 0 ft. for both if the wing and legs aren't moving)

entries: To be used as a vehicle, the apparagoose requires one pilot. While the apparagoose's porthole is closed, the compartment is airtight and holds enough air for 8 hours of breathing.

The Apparagoose floats on water and can move at its land speed on it, but can't go willingly underwater. If it goes underwater it immediately shrinks back in the egg form and any passenger inside is expelled outside, in the nearest unoccupied space, suffering {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.

A creature in the compartment can use an action to move as many as two of the apparagoose's levers up or down. After each use, a lever goes back to its neutral position. Each lever, from left to right, functions as shown in the {@table apparagoose of Honkish Levers|Honkonomicon} table.

item.name: Cane of the Silly Goose
entries: This walking cane has 7 charges for the following properties:

entries.name: Honk
entries: While holding the cane, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and magically influence a creature of your choice that you can see within 60 ft. and that can hear you. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect.The target must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw (goose beasts have no save). On a failed save, the target does nothing more than honk as loud as possible and becomes {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Cone of Silliness
entries: While holding the cane, you can use an action to expend 2 charges, causing the wand's tip to emit a 20-foot cone of iridescent light. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become affected by the {@spell confusion} spell for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, a creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The cane regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the cane's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the cane transforms into a {@item wand of wonder}.

item.name: Crown of the Flaming Goose
entries: Legend says that a set of these crowns were forged from the steel of the chains with which the abyssal lord Pazuzu tried (unsuccessfully) to control Anserath, the Honking Chaos.
Whilst wearing this crown you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on all saving throws against fire and you are immune to any negative consequences inflicted by nonmagical {@hazard extreme heat} conditions.

When one of your allies takes damage within a 30-foot radius, you can use your reaction to benefit from their pain. Choose a target that you can see, the first time you deal damage to that target on your next turn it takes an extra {@damage 1d12} fire damage that ignores resistance to fire.
If you are a spellcaster you learn the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip. If you already know this cantrip it deals {@damage 1d10} extra damage.
You gain the flaw "I deeply enjoy the suffering of both allies and enemies, and I will do everything I can to continue this pleasure", or a similar flaw in accordance with your DM.

item.name: Eyeglasses of Mother Goose
entries: These elegant glasses are said to have once belonged to the legendary fey known as {@creature Mother Goose|Honkonomicon}. When you are attuned to these eyeglasses you gain these benefits:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

You gain proficiency with the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Nature} and {@skill Religion}. If you already have proficiency with one of these skills, you gain expertise in that skill instead. If you already have expertise with one of these skills, when you make a check with that skill, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

You can spend 10 minutes telling beautiful stories and nursery rhymes to your companions, shoring up their morale and mental strength. When you do so, choose up to eight friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} for one hour. Once you use this feature, then you can't use it again until the next dawn.

You can cast the cantrip {@spell Gooseance|Honkonomicon}* at will. If you already know this cantrip you can choose to avoid the effect that makes you and the target express only by honking (see the spell text).

item.name: Golden Egg of Divinity
entries: The Golden Egg of Divinity is an object of legend, about which famous bards have written tales, many of which are particularly loved by children. Some say it was laid by the {@creature Great Golden Goose|Honkonomicon} itself, others say it's the same egg from which the {@creature Great Golden Goose|Honkonomicon} was generated. All this does nothing but fuel the age-old question, which came first: the goose or the egg? However, what all the stories agree on is that this palm-sized golden egg has a perfectly smooth and totally undamaged surface. It effuses a pleasant warmth to the touch, and despite its delicate appearance it seems totally indifferent to any impact or damage. Throughout history, only a lucky few have come into possession of the Egg, which has always brought them great prosperity. It is equally well known that when feelings of greed and evil have made their way into the heart of those who possessed the Egg, it has always brought great misfortune before mysteriously disappearing.

entries.name: Benevolent Magic Focus
entries: The Golden Egg of Divinity can be used as a spellcasting focus by any spellcaster attuned to it, while carried or held. An evil creature that attunes to the Golden Egg of Divinity immediately suffers the effects of the {@reward Curse of the Golden Feathers|Honkonomicon} (see "Curses" earlier in this chapter) that can't be prevented in any way.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The Golden Egg of Divinity has the following randomly determined properties:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|DMG|minor beneficial} properties
2 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|DMG|major beneficial} properties

entries.name: Spells
entries: The Golden Egg of Divinity has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. While carrying or holding it you can use an action and expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells (save {@dc 18} and {@hit 4} spellcasting ability modifier, or {@dcYourSpellSave} and your spellcasting ability modifier, if higher) among: {@spell calm emotions} (2 charges), {@spell cure wounds} (1 charge per spell level, up to 5th), {@spell fabricate} (4 charges), {@spell gaze of the golden goose|Honkonomicon}* (6 charges), {@spell goodberry} (1 charge), {@spell greater restoration} (5 charges), {@spell protection from evil and good} (1 charge), {@spell remove curse} (3 charges). You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the Divine Golden Egg without using any charge: {@spell animal friendship}, {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell druidcraft}, {@spell guidance}, {@spell light}.

entries.name: As Luck Would Have it
entries: You can expend 1 charge (no action required) whenever you or any other creature within a 60-foot radius of the Egg makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, to roll an additional {@dice d20} and use the one that uses the highest number. You can choose to do this after the roll, but before the outcome is determined. When you do this no other creature, even with the {@feat Lucky} feat, can spend luck points or do anything else to influence the outcome of the roll any further.

entries.name: Prosperity
entries: Daily at dawn the Egg can create one seemingly identical copy of itself. The copy has no magical power but is made of solid gold. To make this happen, the owner of the Golden Egg of Divinity must make at least one true and selfless gesture of altruism or goodwill towards others the day before. One solid gold egg can be sold for 500 gp, alternatively it can be used to replace any type of expensive component needed for spellcasting (only by a spellcaster of good alignment), up to a maximum of 1000 gp worth of materials.

entries.name: Kindhearted
entries: The Golden Egg of Divinity can disappear if its owner repeatedly behaves in a greedy, selfish or cruel way.
It can only be stopped by casting a {@spell wish} spell each week, however there is a {@chance 10} chance that this is still not enough to stop it.

entries.name: Destroying the Golden Egg of Divinity
entries: It is said that the Golden Egg of Divinity cannot be destroyed until time itself is destroyed and the question "which came first" is answered. However, cooking the Golden Egg for 24 hours in the heat of the Elemental Plane of Fire and then feeding it to the {@creature tarrasque} makes it disappear for {@dice 1d100} years.

item.name: Goose Cooker
entries: This item is a small depiction of {@creature Anserath, the Honking Chaos|Honkonomicon}. It weighs 10 pounds and has 6 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges, whereupon a corresponding number of heads open their beaks with the following effects:

items: One head (1 charge) generates a spark that can instantly light a {@item candle|PHB}, a {@item torch|PHB}, a small campfire or one flammable object within 20 feet that isn't being worn or carried.

Two heads (2 charges) generates a sheet of black flames. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw (save {@dc 13}). A creature takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage plus {@damage 1d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
Three heads (3 charges) erupt in a powerful honk as per the {@spell chaos honk|Honkonomicon}* spell (save {@dc 15}).

entries: Every time you spend more than 1 charge roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1 the chaos and rage of Anserath temporarily breaks through the object. Each creature within 20-foot radius (including the bearer of the item) must make a Dexterity saving throw (save {@dc 15}). A creature takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage plus {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After that Anserath is pleased and the Goose Cooker instantly regains {@dice 1d3} charges.
The item regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the item transforms into a {@item decanter of endless water}.

item.name: Goose Quill
entries: This apparently ordinary goose quill hides a spark of the mischievous nature of the {@creature Ur-goose|Honkonomicon}, Primordial of Havonk. While using this quill you gain proficiency in the {@item forgery kit|PHB}. If you already have proficiency in the {@item forgery kit|PHB} you have advantage in all Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks made to hide the truth in something you are writing, like a false report written for someone you want to trick, or a false love letter for someone you want to scam.

item.name: Goose Wine
entries: The liquid of this potion looks just like plain drinking water. When you drink this potion you regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points and you gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the beginning of your next turn. After drinking this potion roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1 you discover too late that this is not a Goose Wine potion but a Go Swine potion. You immediately become a {@creature boar} for {@dice 1d4} rounds and you are under the effect of {@spell confusion} spell while in this form.

item.name: Goosebumps Cloak
entries: This gorgeous cloak of white feathers with a golden sheen is said to be a gift from the {@creature Great Golden Goose|Honkonomicon} itself to protect all kind-hearted creatures. While wearing this cloak you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on all saving throws against cold and you are immune to any negative consequences inflicted by nonmagical {@hazard extreme cold} conditions.

You can use a bonus action to turn the cloak into a pair of white goose wings on your back for 1 minute. The wings give you a flying speed of 50 feet. When they disappear, you can't use them again for 1 hour.

You can cast {@spell feather fall} spell and {@spell warding bond} spell without any material component. Once the cloak has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn.
You gain the personality trait "I watch over my friends as if they were new hatched goslings" or a similar one in accordance with the DM.

item.name: Gooseslinger
entries: This {@item light crossbow|PHB} is carved with images of geese wearing cowboy hats. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The crossbow is also fitted with a round magazine that can hold up to eight crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.
The weapon has 3 charges. When you hit with a ranged attack you can expend 1 of its charge and the {@item dart|PHB} fired immediately transforms to create one of the following effects.

items.name: Exploding egg
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 3d6} force damage.

items.name: Fluffy feathers
entries: The creature you hit doesn't take any damage, instead it regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Dexterity modifier. This has no effect on undead or constructs.

items.name: Stinky poop
entries: The target must make a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 15}) against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action retching and reeling until the end of its next turn. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

If you score a critical hit the geese carved on the crossbow get excited and the weapon immediately regains 1 charge, if you score a natural 1 on attack roll the geese silently start booing you and the weapon loses 1 charge. The weapon regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Honkarina
entries: This beautiful ocarina was made from the shards of the Great Golden Goose's eggshell and shows rainbow reflections when lit by sunlight. When attuned to this object you gain a use of {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|PHB|1|PHB} and you have advantage in all Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made with this object.
If you are a {@class bard} you also gain the following benefits:

items: You can use an action to play the instrument and cast the {@spell enhance ability} spell, the {@spell honkeous laughter|Honkonomicon}* spell or the {@spell plumage armor|Honkonomicon}* spell. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You gain 1 fortune coin. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend your fortune coin to roll an additional {@dice d20}. You can choose to spend your fortune coin after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the {@dice 2d20|d20s} is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

item.name: Honkenbonker
entries: Ominous tales speak of the creation of these weapons: it seems that they were forged by {@creature Ur-goose|Honkonomicon}, Primordial of Havonk himself, who gave them to mortals to bring devastation to civilization and cast uncertainty on the plans of those who thought they could control nature.
Even if you are not attuned to this weapon you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. If you are attuned to the weapon you gain the following benefits:

items: The weapon ignores any resistance to bludgeoning damage. Whenever the weapon hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.
{@quickref Difficult terrain||3} doesn't slow you and you leave behind no tracks or other traces of your passage.
You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment or know your creature type.
Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.

You can use an action to strike the ground and cast the {@spell earthquake} spell centered on you. You are immune to the effect of the spell and you can use your Strength for determining your spellcasting ability and spell save DC. Once the weapon has been used to cast the spell it can't be used to cast it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Honkonomicon
entries: The Honkonomicon is the realization of an absurd ambition: to control chaos through chaos. The book's cover was bound in the skin of one of the many heads of {@creature Anserath, the Honking Chaos|Honkonomicon|Anserath}, its pages are made of paper fabricated by the {@creature Ur-goose|Honkonomicon}, and they were written with a quill from the {@creature Great Golden Goose|Honkonomicon} herself. The whole crafting process happened in the Limbo, the plane of pure chaos, where the mind has power over matter and energy. By doing so, they created a book that could hold all knowledge (both magical and mundane) about goosekind, and a tool to realize the impossible: to control the geese.

However, it had to be an imperfect tool, as the magic of the Honkonomicon (and the geese it must control) is chaotic by default. Even if carrying the book gives great power over goosekind, using it can always carry with it some unpredictable consequence. After its creation, the Honkonomicon passed into uncountable different hands, with many expert (and ambitious) spellcasters finding their end because of the book's unstable magic.

entries.name: Honkuesque Knowledge
entries: Even if you are not attuned to it, you can reference the Honkonomicon whenever you make an Intelligence check to discern information about goose creatures or a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to track a goose creature. When you do so, you can add double your proficiency bonus to the check.

entries.name: Wild Magic
entries: Whoever carries or holds the book (even without being attuned to it) gains the {@subclassFeature Wild Magic Surge|Sorcerer|PHB|Wild Magic|PHB|1|PHB} feature just as if it was a wild magic sorcerer. If the creature already has this feature, now it also triggers it on a 20.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The artifact has the follow random properties, which you can determine by rolling on the tables in the "Artifacts" section of the Dungeon Master's Guide:

items: {@dice 1d4} {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|DMG|minor beneficial} properties
{@dice 1d4} {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|DMG|minor detrimental} properties
{@dice 1d3} {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|DMG|major beneficial} properties
{@dice 1d3} {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|DMG|major detrimental} properties

entries.name: Honkontrollable Powers
entries: When you use the Spells feature of this artifact or you cast a spell affected by Goosomancy (see below), make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) or Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) check {@dc 12} + the spell's level. If you fail, or if you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20}, you trigger a {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB|wild magic effect} (see Wild Magic on the Player's Handbook) and one or more goose creatures appear. They are usually hostile towards you, and they have a total CR up to double the spell's level (the DM picks them, see {@book Chapter 4: Goostarium|Honkonomicon|4}).

entries.name: Spells
entries: The Honkonomicon has 17 charges. It regains {@dice 2d8 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. While carrying or holding it you can use an action and expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells (save {@dc 20} and {@hit 5} spellcasting ability modifier, or your spell save DC and your spellcasting ability modifier, if higher) from it: {@spell call of the Ur-goose|Honkonomicon}* (8 charges), {@spell chaos honk|Honkonomicon}* (4 charges), {@spell conjure honkland beings|Honkonomicon}* (4 charges), {@spell find giant goose steed|Honkonomicon}* (3 charges), {@spell gander's blow|Honkonomicon}* (2 charges), {@spell gaze of the golden goose|Honkonomicon}* (6 charges), {@spell goosefeather fall|Honkonomicon}* (2 charges), {@spell planar binding} (5 charges, affects only goose creatures—see Goosological Magic), {@spell plumage armor|Honkonomicon}* (1 charge), {@spell power word quill|Honkonomicon}* (9 charges), {@spell storm of the honking chaos|Honkonomicon}* (7 charges), {@spell summon goose guardian|Honkonomicon}* (5 charges), {@spell swift quillver|Honkonomicon}* (5 charges), {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon}* (3 charges). You can choose to cast any of these spells using your spell slots instead.

You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the Honkonomicon without using any charges: {@spell gooseance|Honkonomicon}, {@spell honkeous laughter|Honkonomicon}, {@spell quill the dead|Honkonomicon}*.

entries.name: Variant: Circle of the Honk Spells
entries: If you own {@loader Circle of the Honk|collection/Vall Syrene; Circle of the Honk.json}, add all spells from that book to the Spell feature of the {@item Honkonomicon|Honkonomicon} artifact. Casting one of these spells costs 1 charge per spell level.

entries.name: Goosomancy
entries: While holding or carrying this book, any spell that you cast that would have specific effects against fiends or other extraplanar creatures (like {@spell protection from evil and good}, {@spell magic circle} or {@spell planar binding}) can also affect goose creatures in the same way. When you use such a spell against a goose creature, you can increase the spell's level up to 9th without consuming slots of a higher level (regardless of what spell slot you used, if any) and the goose creature has disadvantage on its saving throw against the spell. Additionally, a {@spell protection from evil and good} spell that only affects goose creatures is active on you while you are carrying or holding the book (no {@status concentration} required). If dispelled, the book activates this spell on you again at the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Destroying the Honkonomicon
entries: To destroy the book, each of the three geese of power must tear out a third of the book's pages. If this occurs, the pages reappear after 24 hours.

Before all those hours pass, anyone who opens the book's remaining binding is transported to a location close to the heart of the Limbo through the book. There, the book must be thrown into the swirling core of the plane of chaos, assuming that the character can survive the plane and its inhabitants. One or more {@creature death slaad||death slaads} will try to stop this effort.

item.name: Manual of Feathers Golems
entries: This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a particular type of golem. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly. To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a manual of golems and attempts to read it takes {@damage 6d6} psychic damage.

To create a {@creature feathers golem|Honkonomicon}, you must spend 20 days, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay 25,000 gp to purchase supplies. Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

item.name: The Real Game of the Goose
entries: This popular board game is imbued with the magical and chaotic energies of geese. When two or more creatures (up to a maximum of eight) play with it against each other for at least 1 hour, they make a {@dice d20} roll (applying the {@item dice set|PHB} proficiency to the roll, if any).
The creature that scores higher rolls a {@dice d6}:

items: Until the end of your next long rest you can cast the {@spell speak with animals} spell once, without spending a spell slot or providing any components.
You gain {@dice 1d6 + 1} temporary hit points.
Until the end of your next long rest you gain advantage on your next {@skill Persuasion} (Charisma) check.
Until the end of your next long rest you add {@dice 1d4} on your next saving throw.
You gain inspiration.
You automatically succeed the first death saving throw made within the next 24 hours.

entries: The creature that scores lower, and anyone who has been caught cheating, rolls a {@dice d6}:

items: Until the end of your next long rest all geese are hostile towards you and attack you on sight.
Until the end of your next long rest you randomly honk while speaking.
Until the end of your next long rest all your hair (if any) becomes feathers (color chosen by DM).
For the next hour you can only walk backward.
You instantly honk and lay an egg. Everyone nearby knows it.
You gain webbed hands (see {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon}* spell) that lasts until you roll a natural 1 or 20 on a {@dice d20} roll.

entries: After using the real game of the goose you can't use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Totally Normal Goose Figurine (Figurine of Wondrous Power)
entries: This new kind of {@item figurine of wondrous power} is a statuette of a common white goose that looks totally normal. However, with a successful {@dc 10} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check you can find that the goose holds a little knife in his beak.This statuette can become a {@creature demogoose of many mouths|Honkonomicon} for 1 minute. Unlike other {@item figurine of wondrous power||figurines of wondrous power} the creature is hostile towards everyone and will attack the closest creature to the best of its ability. The {@creature demogoose of many mouths|Honkonomicon|demogoose} understands your languages but does not obey your spoken commands. At the end of the minute of transformation roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1 the {@creature demogoose of many mouths|Honkonomicon} is totally free and does not revert to its figurine form. If it reverts to its figurine form it can't be used again until 7 days have passed or until you make a worthy sacrifice to Anserath.

item.name: Wild Goose Chasers
entries: These boots are said to have been created by disciples of the {@creature Ur-goose|Honkonomicon} to spread disorder and confusion in the name of their patron. While you wear them you leave tracks like those of a goose the size of a grown man. You also gain the following benefits:

items: You can use a bonus action to gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed. This effect lasts for 10 minutes and you can't use it again until next dawn.

You can use a bonus action to move through solid earth or rock without any hindrance, you also gain the benefits of {@spell freedom of movement} spell. If you end your turn there, you are shunted out to the nearest unoccupied space you last occupied. This effect lasts for 1 round and you can't use it again until the next dawn.

itemFluff.name: Totally Normal Goose Figurine (Figurine of Wondrous Power)

monster.name: Anserath, the Honking Chaos

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Anserath casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal component and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 23}):
will: {@spell dominate beast} (goose beasts have no save)

trait.name: Berserker Honkwakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Anserath would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 310 hit points, it recharges its Cachonkphonical Madness, it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance, and it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage for 1 hour. Additionally, Anserath can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 50,000 XP (100,000 XP total) for defeating the Anserath after its Berserk Honkwakening activates.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: Anserath ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Anserath fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Anserath has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: Anserath can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

trait.name: Uncountable Heads
entries: Anserath has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Anserath attacks with its Webbed Claws twice, then can attack each target in reach with A Thousand Beaks or cast a spell.

action.name: Webbed Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) magical piercing damage. Once per turn, Anserath can force a hit target to make a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw, pulling the target within 5 feet of Anserath's space on a failed save.

action.name: A Thousand Beaks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d4 + 8}) magical piercing damage and the target becomes {@condition grappled} ({@dc 23} to escape).

action.name: Abyssal Honks {@recharge 5}
entries: Each of Anserath's heads honks horribly and the demon chooses up to six points it can see within 150 feet. Each of these points magically bursts into a 15-foot radius honksplosion and everything in the area is affected by one of the following effects. A target in the area ofmore than one burst is affected only once. Roll a {@dice d6}:

items.name: 1–2
items.entry: Each target makes a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable materials in the area catch fire. The area becomes heavily obscured by smoke until the end of Anserath's next turn.

items.name: 3–4
items.entry: Each target makes a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 49 ({@damage 9d10}) thunder damage andis pushed into the closest space out of the area. On a failed save by 5 or more, a target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: 5–6
items.entry: Each creature makes a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 66 ({@damage 12d10}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Anserath makes an attack.

legendary.name: Cachonkphonical Madness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each of Anserath's heads honks disturbingly. Every creature within 20 feet of Anserath that can hear it makes a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success or taking another 6 ({@damage 1d12}) psychic damage on a failed save. A creature that goes to 0 hit points while {@condition frightened} in this way receives a {@table long-term madness|DMG} (see {@book Chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG|8}).

legendary.name: Feed the Geese (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by Anserath takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) magical piercing damage, becomes {@condition restrained} while {@condition grappled} and makes a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature develops a random goose mutation (see {@table Fowlish Mutations|Honkonomicon} for the table and for how to heal from it). After three of these mutations, a creature turns into a {@creature demogoose|Honkonomicon}*. A creature affected by the {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon} spell counts as already having one of these mutations.

mythicHeader: If Anserath's Berserker Honkwakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Charge of A Thousand Beaks (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Anserath moves up to its speed in a straight line. When Anserath enters the area of a creature while doing so, it attacks the creature with A Thousand Beaks.

mythic.name: Honkfusion
entries: Anserath casts the {@spell confusion} spell with its Spellcasting.

trait.name: Filthy Fly
entries: When the demogoose flies, each creature within 10 feet of its starting and landing point makes a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The demogoose ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Barbed Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage and the target makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on its next ability check or attack roll before 1 minute has passed because of the pain of the bite.

action.name: Honk of Terror
entries: The demogoose honks into the air to put terror in the hearts of its enemies. Each creature of the demogoose's choice that is within 60 feet of the demogoose and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

The demogoose has advantage on attack rolls against {@condition frightened} creatures. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the demogoose's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The demogoose breathes fire in a 40-foot line in front of it. Any creature in the area makes a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The demogoose ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: The demogoose has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Toxic Fly
entries: When the demogoose flies, each creature within 10 feet of its starting and landing point makes a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demogoose makes three attacks with its Barbed Beak. It can make a Honk of Terror or a Fire Breath instead of any of these attacks.

action.name: Barbed Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage and the target makes a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on its next ability check or attack roll before 1 minute has passed because of the pain of the bite.

action.name: Honk of Terror
entries: The demogoose honks into the air to put terror in the hearts of its enemies. Each creature of the demogoose's choice that is within 60 feet of the demogoose and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

The demogoose has advantage on attack rolls against {@condition frightened} creatures. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the demogoose's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The demogoose breathes fire in a 40-foot line in front of it. Any creature in the area makes a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

trait.name: Alertness
entries: The goose has a +5 bonus to its passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The goose can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Honk (1/Day)
entries: The goose honks aggressively towards a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Lay Golden Egg (1/Day)
entries: The goose lays a golden egg (usually at dawn). The egg is worth 100 gp and can be used in place of any material component up to that value. A creature using the egg for evil or egoistic purposes might receive a curse, like the {@spell bestow curse} or {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon}* spell, or one of the curses from {@book Chapter 1|Honkonomicon|1} (same DC of the Spellcasting action, if necessary).

While laying the egg, or later while touching it as an action, the goose can infuse one of its spells in the egg (including {@spell gooseance|Honkonomicon}*) that will trigger once at a condition established by the goose.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a pile of feathers and filth.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: If the ooze takes fire damage, it catches fire. While on fire, the ooze takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the end of each of its turns, but the ooze's melee attacks dealan extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. The ooze stops being on fire if it receives cold damage or is exposed to water or a similar liquid. Pouring a liquid on the ooze takes an action.

action.name: Feathered Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the target has a nose and is not immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition, it makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target starts to sneeze uncontrollably and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If the target goes at 0 hit points, it makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw to not contract the {@disease sewer plague} disease (see {@book Chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG|8}).

monster.name: Feathered Wrath

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the feathered wrath canmove up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Death by Calmness
entries: If the feathered wrath receives the {@spell calm emotions} spell or suffers from an effect that prevents it from attacking any creature within 60 feet of it, the feathered wrath takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) psychic damage at the beginning of its turn.

trait.name: Wrathful Awakening (1/Rest)
entries: Even if the feathered wrath is dead, its wrath might bring it back to life. At initiative count 20 (or at the initiative count rolled by the feathered wrath, at the DM's choice) roll a {@dice d6} if two or more creatures within 30 feet of the feathered wrath's body made an attack roll or acted violently in some other way. On 5 or 6, the feathered wrath comes back to life with half of its maximum hit points. After coming back to life in this way, the feathered wrath can't do it again until the end of its next short or long rest.
The feathered wrath can't activate this ability if it was beheaded, if it has no body left or if it was killed by radiant damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The feathered wrath makes a dagger melee attack against each and every target within reach (without distinction, but without attacking itself) or makes three dagger ranged attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Undying Wrath
entries: Some specimens of feathered wrath are driven by a destructive will strong enough to possess nearby creatures even after their destruction. In these cases, remove the Wrathful Awakening ability and substitute it with the following:

entries.name: Wrathful Possession (1/Rest)
entries: When the feathered wrath dies, the creature that killed it (if it is within 40 feet) must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the goose's wrathful spirit. A possessed creature acts mindlessly and uses its turns only to attack in melee any creature to the best of its abilities. The creature's movement, actions and reactions will only have this purpose. The wrathful spirit has the same statistic of the feathered wrath but can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points or the wrathful spirit is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the wrathful spirit vanishes.
A feathered wrath with this ability has a challenge rating of 4 (1,100 XP).

monster.tokenCredit: Polina Sokolova, edited by Simone Malvezzi

items.name: Wrathful Possession (1/Rest)
entries: When the feathered wrath dies, the creature that killed it (if it is within 40 feet) must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the goose's wrathful spirit. A possessed creature acts mindlessly and uses its turns only to attack in melee any creature to the best of its abilities. The creature's movement, actions and reactions will only have this purpose. The wrathful spirit has the same statistic of the feathered wrath but can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points or the wrathful spirit is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the wrathful spirit vanishes.
A feathered wrath with this ability has a challengerating of 4 (1,100 XP).

monster.name: Feathers Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The golem can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5–6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Flammable Body
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn. However the golem's body immediately catches fire. While on fire, the golem takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the end of each of its turn, but the golem's melee attacks deal an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. The golem stops being on fire if it receives cold damage, is exposed to water or a similar liquid or if the golem makes a successful {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw as an action to turn off the fire. Pouring a liquid on the golem also requires an action.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Feathered Slam attacks.

action.name: Feathered Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) magical bludgeoning damage. If the target has a nose and is not immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition, it makes a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target starts to sneeze uncontrollably and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Quill Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) magical piercing damage.

action.name: Quill Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem sprays quills in a 40-foot cone, or in a 20-foot radius area centered on itself. All other creatures in the area make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) magical piercing damage plus an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage if the golem is on fire, and the target subtracts the result of {@dice d6} to any ability check or attack roll. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and no {@dice d6} penalty. The {@dice d6} penalty lasts until the target receives 5 or more points of magical healing or until the quills are removed with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check as an action.
A creature that fails a saving throw against this action more than once within 24 hours also becomes targeted by the {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon} spell ({@dc 12}).

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The geese can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The geese can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the geese can move through any opening large enough for a Small goose. The geese can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geese attack with their beaks against any number of targets inside the geese's space.

action.name: Beaks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) piercing damage damage or 4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

bonus.name: Mass Honk {@recharge 5}
entries: The geese honk aggressively towards all other creatures inside their space. A target makes a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target becomes {@condition deafened} for 1 minute and has disadvantage on its next ability check or attack roll.

trait.name: Alertness
entries: The goose has a +5 bonus to its passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Fearless Fowl
entries: The goose has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The goose can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Honk {@recharge 5}
entries: The goose emits a terrifying honk in a 30-foot-radius sphere. Other creatures that can hear the goose and are aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw to not become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the goose's Honk for the next 24 hours.

_versions.name: Giant Goose Steed (Anserath)
languages: understands one known by the summoner but can't speak

_versions.name: Giant Goose Steed (Great Golden Goose)
languages: understands one known by the summoner but can't speak

_versions.name: Giant Goose Steed (Ur-goose)
languages: understands one known by the summoner but can't speak

hp.special: 5 + five times your ranger level (the goose has a number of Hit Dice [d6s] equal to your ranger level)

trait.name: Furious Fowl
entries: The goose deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage to creatures {@condition frightened} of it.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The goose can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2 + PB}) piercing damage.

action.name: Honk (1/Day)
entries: The goose honks aggressively at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against the ranger's spell save DC or be {@condition frightened} of the goose for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can attempt this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The goose casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal component and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

spellcasting.name: Gooseance
headerEntries: The goose sternly honks at a creature failing an attack roll, ability check or saving throw and casts the {@spell gooseance|Honkonomicon}* spell on it. A willing creature targeted by this spell adds {@dice 1d4} to the failing roll that triggered the reaction, potentially turning it to success. Whether this happens or not, for the next minute you and that creature can't speak but can honk.

trait.name: Alertness
entries: The goose has a +5 bonus to its passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Curse of the Golden Feathers
entries: A creature that touches or hits with a melee attack the goose must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained}, the creature is stuck to the goose and will follow it wherever it goes, unless the goose is being moved with teleportation. The {@condition restrained} condition lasts until the creature receives the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic, or the goose ends the effect as a bonus action.
A creature touching or hitting with a melee attack another creature {@condition restrained} in this way is also targeted by the {@reward Curse of the Golden Feathers|Honkonomicon}.
The goose is immune to this curse.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The goose ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Luck of Gold
entries: When the goose rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, it can roll a second time and keep the new result. The goose can extend this benefit to a creature at its choice within 30 feet of the goose.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The goose has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goose makes two attacks with its magical beak. It can cast a spell instead of making one of these attacks.

action.name: Magical Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) magical bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage.

bonus.name: Unseen Teleport (1/Day)
entries: When out of sight of any other creature, the goose can magically teleport itself, along with any equipment that it's wearing or carrying, to a location the goose is familiar with, up to 1 mile away.

variant.name: Goose of the Golden Eggs
entries: Some geese of the golden feathers have the ability to lay golden eggs, as per the following action:

entries.name: Lay Golden Egg (1/Day)
entries: The goose lays a golden egg (usually at dawn). The egg is worth 100 gp and can be used in place of any material component up to that value. A creature using the egg for evil or egoistic purposes might receive a curse, like the {@spell bestow curse} or {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon}* spell, or one of the curses from {@book Chapter 1|Honkonomicon|1} (same DC of the Spellcasting action, if necessary).

While laying the egg, or later while touching it as an action, the goose can infuse one of its spells in the egg (including {@spell gooseance|Honkonomicon}*) that will trigger once at a condition established by the goose.

Some geese of the golden feathers with this action have no golden feathers at all, as they look just like regular geese. In this case, remove the Curse of the Golden Feathers ability. Sometimes, even regular domestic or wild geese have the ability to lay golden eggs. Such a geese has the Celestial creature type instead of Beast.

items.name: Lay Golden Egg (1/Day)
entries: The goose lays a golden egg (usually at dawn). The egg is worth 100 gp and can be used in place of any material component up to that value. A creature using the egg for evil or egoistic purposes might receive a curse, like the {@spell bestow curse} or {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon}* spell, or one of the curses from {@book Chapter 1|Honkonomicon|1} (same DC of the Spellcasting action, if necessary).

While laying the egg, or later while touching it as an action, the goose can infuse one of its spells in the egg (including {@spell gooseance|Honkonomicon}*) that will trigger once at a condition established by the goose.

_versions.name: Goose of the Golden Eggs (No Curse)

items.name: Lay Golden Egg (1/Day)
entries: The goose lays a golden egg (usually at dawn). The egg is worth 100 gp and can be used in place of any material component up to that value. A creature using the egg for evil or egoistic purposes might receive a curse, like the {@spell bestow curse} or {@spell web limbs|Honkonomicon}* spell, or one of the curses from {@book Chapter 1|Honkonomicon|1} (same DC of the Spellcasting action, if necessary).

While laying the egg, or later while touching it as an action, the goose can infuse one of its spells in the egg (including {@spell gooseance|Honkonomicon}*) that will trigger once at a condition established by the goose.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: A goose skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Goose Spirit

type.note: ; celestial (Honking Defender); fiend (Chaos Gander); elemental (Primal Honker)

ac.special: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor) + 2 (honking defender only)

languages: understands the languages you speak but can express only through honking

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} by the spirit's beak if it's Huge or smaller (escape DC equals {@dcYourSpellSave}).

action.name: Booming Honk (Primal Honker Only)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} thunder damage and any creature within 10 feet of the target must make a Constitution saving throw or take the same damage and fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Honk of Fury (Chaos Gander Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} fire damage and any creature within 5 feet of the target (including the target itself) can use its reaction to make one melee attack.

action.name: Threatening Honk (Honking Defender Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} radiant damage and the target makes a successful Wisdom saving throw to not be {@condition frightened} until the end of the spirit's next turn.

ac.special: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)
13 + the level of the spell (natural armor)
11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

monster.name: Goose Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life butcan't speak

trait.name: Rotten Flight
entries: If the goose zombie ends its turn flying, it makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the goose zombie starts to fall.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the goose zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw witha DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the goose zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: A goose zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Honk (1/Day)
entries: The goose zombie honks aggressively towards a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The collective casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):
will: {@spell suggestion} (also works on any goose creature regardless of type)

will.entry: {@spell wall of fire} (in lair, thunder damage)

trait.name: A Lot of Geese
entries: The collective can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the collective can move through any opening large enough for a Small goose.

trait.name: Goose Sense
entries: The collective is aware of goose creatures within 5 miles of it. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the collective fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The collective has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The collective makes one Mind Beak melee attack against any number of targets in reach, or up to three ranged attacks.

action.name: Mind Beak
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Honk {@recharge 5}
entries: The collective magically emits a psychic honk in a 60 foot radius around itself. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 40 ({@damage 10d6 + 5}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Absorb Goose
entries: The collective targets an {@condition incapacitated} goose creature inside the collective's space. The target makes a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target disappears (becoming one with the collective), the collective's maximum hit points increase by the number of Hit Dice of the target, and the collective immediately recharges its Psychic Honk. The absorbed creature can be retrieved only after the destruction of the collective.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The collective uses Spellcasting (only spells that can be used at will or three times per day).

legendary.name: Fowlish Intrusion
entries: The collective targets an {@condition incapacitated} creature within 60 feet that it can see. The target makes a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition charmed}. While {@condition charmed}, it believes to be a goose, behaves as such and adds the goose tag to its creature type. The affected target communicates only in honks and can't cast spells with a verbal component. A creature repeats this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After three failures on this repeated saving throw, the effect lasts until it's removed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Mind Beak
entries: The collective makes one Mind Beak attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The collective magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Alertness
entries: The gray honker has a +5 bonus to its passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Gliding Leap
entries: The gray honker's long jump is up to 50 ft., with or without a running start. If the gray honker makes an attack after the jump, it does so with advantage and deals an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) damage with that attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gray honker makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, the target becomes {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage if the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Song of the Honker {@recharge 5}
entries: The gray honker can use this action only if it didn't move this turn and if it has a speed superior to 0. The gray honker dances in its place while emitting horrible sounds and violently scratching against the surrounding terrain and objects. The gray honker makes a claw attack against every target of its choice within reach. Until the beginning of its next turn, the gray honker's speed becomes 0 and it has resistance to all damage. Any other creature that can hear the gray honker within 40 feet makes a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition deafened}, can't take reactions, has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls and its base speed is halved. A creature that can't be {@condition stunned} doesn't suffer from this disadvantage and speed reduction. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Caring Wings
entries: The gray honker gains three-quarters cover (+5 AC, +5 to Dexterity saving throws) against one attack or effect that would affect it. Alternatively, it can give three-quarters cover to a creature of its choice within 10 feet. If the covered creature takes any damage from the triggering effect, it takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the gray honker takes the other half.
To use this reaction, the gray honker must see the source of the effect. The gray honker can't use its Gliding Leap until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Great Golden Goose

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Goose casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal component and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 25}):
will: {@spell animal friendship} (goose beasts have no save)

spellcasting.name: Time Transcendence (Costs 3 Actions)
headerEntries: The Goose casts the {@spell time stop} spell. She can't do it again until the next Golden Rebirth.

trait.name: Blessed Honkmniscence
entries: The Goose can't be {@status surprised} and has advantage on initiative rolls, as well as on Intelligence and Wisdom checks. Additionally, when the Goose rolls a natural 1 on an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, it can ignore the result and roll again.

trait.name: Feathers of Magic Immunity
entries: The Goose can't be affected or detected by spells of 5th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Golden Rebirth (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Goose would be reduced to 0 hit points, her current hit point total instead resets to 300 hit points, she recharges her Honk of Fate, and she regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Goose can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 62,000 XP (114,000 XP total) for defeating the Goose after her Golden Rebirth activates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Goose fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Goose makes up to three Blinding Beak or Quills of Gold attacks (in any combination).

action.name: Blinding Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) magical piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage. Once per turn, the Goose can force a target to make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it becomes {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Quill of Gold
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 120/600 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) radiant damage and 5 ({@damage 1d10}) radiant damage at the end of each of its turn, until the target receives 10 or more points of magical healing, the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic, or the quill is removed with a successful {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check as an action.

action.name: Honk of Fate {@recharge 5}
entries: The Goose emits a celestial honk that transcends the meaning of earthly existence, space and time itself. The Goose targets any creature of her choice within 150 feet of her with one of the following effects:

items.name: Honk of Bane
entries: Each target makes a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw. A creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage and 27 ({@damage 6d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. On a failed save by 5 or more, a creature is also cursed with disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic ends the effect on the target while it's still making saving throws.

items.name: Honk of Grace
entries: Each target receives the effects of the {@spell lesser restoration} and {@spell remove curse} spells and regains 33 ({@dice 6d10}) hit points.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell
entries: The Goose uses her Spellcasting, using only spells that can be cast at will or three times per day.

legendary.name: Goosish Omen
entries: The Goose's eyes radiate golden light while she infuses a creature she can see within 120 feet with ominous visions of its future. The target makes a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The Goose magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Wings of the Golden Curtain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Until the end of the Goose's next turn, each creature of her choice (including herself) within a 30-foot radius centered on her gains advantage on all saving throws, and attack rolls against them have disadvantage. Additionally, each target can immediately repeat the saving throw against any ongoing effect affecting it.

mythicHeader: If the Goose's Golden Rebirth trait has activated in the last hour, she can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Retribution of Gold
entries: The next time within 1 minute that the Goose makes a successful saving throw against a spell or magical effect or that such an effect is negated by her magic immunity, the creature that originated the effect is immediately affected by it (making saving throws as normal).

mythic.name: Starry Warp
entries: The Goose bends space with the strength of a true star. The Goose targets any creature of her choice that she can see within 60 feet. Each target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage and makes a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw to not fall {@condition prone} and be teleported 40 feet in a random direction.

trait.name: Chaotic Mount
entries: If the grifoose or a creature riding it rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an ability check or an attack roll, the grifoose becomes confused as per the {@spell confusion} spell until the end of the grifoose's next turn. A creature currently riding the grifoose must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw to not fall off the mount just as the grifoose was moved against its will.

trait.name: Too Stubborn to Run Away
entries: The grifoose can't be {@condition frightened}. Any ability check to control the grifoose or interact with it (like Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling||Handle Animal}) checks) have disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grifoose can use the Honk from Above action, then makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Honk from Above {@recharge 5}
entries: The grifoose honks aggressively towards a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened}, the grifoose has advantage on attack rolls against it.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Fury of the Skein
